main event: A bright light observed in the eastern sky, changing colors from white to orange, then red, with erratic movements, on February 5, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as brilliant as magnesium., The sighting lasted between 3 and 5 minutes., Two witnesses confirmed the observation., The object was observed in the Eastern sky., Speculation concluded that it may have been a star, planet, or satellite due to atmospheric effects.
sighted object: one bright light in the sky
